channel.title: Gopher on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Gopher on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: "brew install lynx", and then Gopher lives on
item.description: Since we're reinventing the Olde Web with systems like tilde.club, here's a screen shot of the current state of Gopher. "brew install lynx" gets a Lynx client on my Mac, and then you point lynx at gopher://gopher.floodgap.com and you're good to go. "ssh new@sdf.org" and you can set yourself up a shell account with a gopher client installed and gopher server space available.

item.title: node-gopher, the White Mesa gopher server for node.js
item.description: node-gopher is a little Gopher protocol server written in node.js by Robert Cunnings, NW8L. It supports an RFC 1436 Gopher server (no Gopher+) and has CGI-like support for running scripts that return Gopher pages. Thanks to Cameron Kaiser for running the Floodgap gopher gateway that provides web access to venerable (and new) Gopherspace resources.

item.title: Pinboard now supports gopher:// URLs
item.description: from @pinboard @Pinboard: @vielmetti @doctorlinguist alright, extremely proud to announce Pinboard now supports the gopher:// scheme To test, go to https://pinboard.in/u:vielmetti/b:7fb419764b79 and examine what you get, following the link to its logical conclusions. To really test, get a Gopher client; I am using Overbite Chrome from Floodgap Systems. Thanks to Cameron Kaiser for noticing, and to Maciej Ceglowski for making it happen. For more coverage of Gopherspace, I occasionally write something at http://vielmetti.

item.title: How twitter and gopher were born, (or) why you should make it work on the worst system first
item.description: this post on "how twitter was born" is making the rounds; thanks to Prentiss Riddle for alerting me to it.   The best quote from it is the use case that involves the worst possible internet device in the world: text messages from a mobile phone. I remember that @Jack’s first use case was city-related: telling people that the club he’s at is happening. “I want to have a dispatch service that connects us on our phones using text.
